intro: Quercus crassipes, commonly known as the Florida栎, is a deciduous tree native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its broad, lobed leaves that turn reddish in the fall. The tree produces small, spiky capsules that contain one or two seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands and swamps. Its ecological importance includes providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
